alert.note: Alert for Pend Oreille (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 21 at 1:26PM PST until February 21 at 2:15PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Pend Oreille County in northeastern Washington... * Until 215 PM PST. * At 120 PM PST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 20 miles southwest of Nordman to 13 miles north of Newport, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 20 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect hazardous road conditions. * This includes U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 331 and 334 and State Route 20 in Washington between mile markers 401 and 437. Locations impacted include... Newport, Cusick, Bead Lake Campground, South Skookum Lake Campground, Browns Lake Campground, Usk, Ruby and Dalkena. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
